intro: Acetosella caespitosa, commonly known as mouse-ear chickweed, is a low-growing perennial plant belonging to the family Montiaceae. It is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit and small, rounded leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white flowers that bloom in early spring, typically from March to May. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodland floors and rocky crevices. Acetosella caespitosa is often found in temperate regions of Europe and is known for its ability to tolerate poor soil conditions.
